inclusion.criterion: follow-up will take place yearly thereafter for 5 years, through clinical visiting, phone follow-up, or records from the NHIB Taiwan.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: vital signs, clinical endpoints, adverse events, concurrent medication information and laboratory specimens will be obtained as complete as possible.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: if the primary care physician intends to treat the patient's lipid profile to the target, he/she can add, delete or adjust the LLT by his/her clinical judgement.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: hemodynamically significant valvular or congenital heart disease
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: any non-cardiovascular diseases which may affect prognosis
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient is a 34-year-old obese woman who comes to the clinic with weight concerns. She has sleep apnea, PCO and dissatisfaction with her body shape.
